title: Btcalysis
author: Btcalysis
content: You will see the better picture from this imageA day is coming when almost all the countries in the world will have bitcoin as a reserve.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: Btcalysis on January 15, 2025, 02:22:14 AMYou will see the better picture from this image Well, no, because the image looks small and there is no way to enlarge it. I don't know where you got that map or if you made it yourself, but it seems a bit optimistic about bitcoin's strategic reserve projects. Enlarge the image and put a link to where you got it, come on, to see if we can see the details better.

comments.author: stadus
comments.body: It’s too early to draw conclusions since it’s just a plan for now. The biggest news we’re waiting for is whether the US will actually pass a law to consider buying Bitcoin as a reserve. For now, the news we’ve heard is about them selling confiscated Bitcoins from the past, probably to close the books on those cases. Who knows, maybe the proceeds from those sales will be used to buy Bitcoin for reserves.If this happens, it’s going to trigger FOMO, and I’m pretty sure everyone else will follow ..

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: We should not be really comfortable with the "In the works" progress because even in the United States, it's still difficult for them. We know how complicated cryptocurrency in the country, and I believe the United States is playing big role in our current cryptocurrency market, it is already proven before.

Who knows, maybe the proceeds from those sales will be used to buy Bitcoin for reserves.If this happens, it’s going to trigger FOMO, and I’m pretty sure everyone else will follow .. That is good point we should wait and see what happens next before making any decisions. Idea of considering Bitcoin as reserve asset is very interesting and it is normal to wonder what might happen if it becomes reality. It is also interesting that they are selling Bitcoins that were taken away from people who broke law. Maybe money they get from selling those Bitcoins will be used to buy more Bitcoins for reserves. If that happens it could make many people want to invest in Bitcoin and other organizations might do same. For now let's just wait and see how things go.

comments.author: Alpha Marine
comments.body: Quote from: Btcalysis on January 15, 2025, 02:22:14 AMA day is coming when almost all the countries in the world will have bitcoin as a reserve. That day if it will ever happen will not be today. It's going to be a long time before countries start having a bitcoin reserve. Bitcoin is against everything they stand against so let's not get ahead of ourselves. Decisions like this take time to happen. It will be deliberated before the bill can finally pass so let's not see it as something that will happen soon. I don't even think there's any country that has gotten to the advanced stages of this decision-making process. This is one minor reason why I belive bitcoin can get to unbelievable prices in the future. By the time a country like the US finally agrees to have a bitcoin reserve, it will mean bitcoin price will soar exponentially because it will create a lot of demand.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: As fiat currencies lose purchasing power and governments don't know what to do anymore to maintain the economy on the rails, Bitcoin becomes a potential solution on long term. It's just unfortunate that governments are likely to become adopters before most average citizens do. Many people could have already started holding Bitcoin, even when their governments don't talk about it or discourage the adoption. However, most people only take a decision based on what the government encourages them to do.Of course there are pros in governments adopting Bitcoin as strategical reserves, but there are also cons as consequences, like harsh regulations imposed over Bitcoin enthusiasts, besides the usual abusive taxation over profits made on BTC sales, which is a dream of every broken governments which aren't willing to cut their own expenses to maintain its functionality.

comments.author: suzanne5223
comments.body: Quote from: Btcalysis on January 15, 2025, 02:22:14 AM[snip]A day is coming when almost all the countries in the world will have bitcoin as a reserve. Bitcoin has huge potential but it's still hard for the government to understand it wholly.Second, Bitcoin provide a vast benefits but it's still not the answer to every economic, and financial issue. If the government use it as their reserve while they lack the needed knowledge it is still a waste of resources.For this reason with the volatility in nature of Bitcoin, I don't see the day the government will have Bitcoin as their only reserve we should expect them to have Bitcoin as 15% max of their reserve, and I expect the country to start it to be the US, or El-salvador.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: Btcalysis on January 15, 2025, 02:22:14 AMA day is coming when almost all the countries in the world will have bitcoin as a reserve. Well it's too early or a conclusion right now. But if majority of the countries actually start adding Bitcoin to their reserve, it will be a Doomsday for the decentralization of Bitcoin. The common investors like you and I, will be at the mercy of these big players. Everything will require KYC and every single transactions will be tracked. I am sure no one would want that!

comments.author: Callido
comments.body: Quote from: Btcalysis on January 15, 2025, 02:22:14 AMA day is coming when almost all the countries in the world will have bitcoin as a reserve.We can say for a few more countries not all not even close to all. About 193-195 countries in the world, and yet none has fully except from El Salvador  with the bold step, the rest are still to fulfil what they said, until it commence we can't add them to the list of ALMOST.  Bitcoin is currently cheap, it should come to their knowledge that as time passes, price spike and some lows can never be touched again.There is some hate for Bitcoin from countries that we do not talk about, this might remain close for ever or change but hence it is evident that the number of countries adopting Bitcoin will certainly increase but not to that multitude.

comments.author: Z-tight

I don't know about that and is it really something good for the BTC network if almost all the countries in the world hold BTC as a strategic reserve, i don't think it is so good because the power of manipulation will be in the hands of centralized institutions and who can tell what they will do. comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: Quote from: Btcalysis on January 15, 2025, 02:22:14 AMA day is coming when almost all the countries in the world will have bitcoin as a reserve. All these Bitcoin strategic reserve considerations are because of the newly elected US president. The US is seen as a pacesetter to other Western countries. More nations will consider buying Bitcoin if Trump finally implements the reserve policy. A few years ago Bitcoiners were seen as lunatics. They were mocked because many of them never believed that Bitcoin would become a generally recognized currency. When these critics observed that it had started gaining prominence, they tagged it as a currency for criminal activities. As they began to realize that Bitcoin is taking centre stage in the global financial system, they now want to be a part of it. This is just the beginning of the reign of Bitcoin.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: Btcalysis on January 15, 2025, 02:22:14 AMA day is coming when almost all the countries in the world will have bitcoin as a reserve. No matter how popular Bitcoin becomes, and even if it has finally been approved by the president-elect, Donald Trump, and the USA makes the first step by adding it to their reserve, not all countries will agree to the idea publicly; almost all countries might have Bitcoin through seizure, but not all will be able to approve it as a reserve. If all go with that idea, that will eventually kill the traditional reserve method (gold).
